post.description:
This request is to add the Auto Discovery Configuration ##### Release Notes * Release Date : 2019 ##### Usage Notes **hostUrl** is required
**integratorId** is required
**organizationId** is required
**infraTypeId** is required
In **repositoryUserDetails** if **overrideAtIntegrator** is set to **false** then **pass** and **pat** value has to be provided
To set **pat** to null during update empty string (**""**) should be sent. If **null** is sent it wont be updated

**Allowable Values :**
**period :** days/weeks/months
**schedule** startDate : yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm
**protocol :** http/https/ssh

delete.description:

 ##### Release Notes 
 * Release Date : 30-Dec-2017

This Request is used Add/Remove Roles to Multiple Groups
 ##### Release Notes 
 * Release Date : 30-Dec-2017

This Request is used to update bulk Developers
 ##### Request Parameters
* **developerId** : 0, required
* **firstName** : "string", required
* **lastName** : "string", required
* **employementStatus** : "string", required
* **employeeType** : "string", Optional, Default value 'Not Provided'
* **employer** : "string", Optional, Default value 'Not Provided'
* **jobRole** : "string", Optional, Default value 'Not Provided'
* **location** : {Optional, Default value country: 'Not provided' and city: 'Not provided' "city": "string", "country": "string"}
* **rank** : "string", Optional, Default value 'Not Provided
* **segment** : "string", Optional, Default value 'Not Provided'
* **UID** : "string", Optional, Value remain unchanged if not passed
* **hourlyRate** : float, Optional, Value remain unchanged if not passed
* **isAnonymized** : false,  Optional, Value remain unchanged if not passed
##### NOTE
Fields which have default values will override the existing value to default value if no value is passed for them in the update
 ##### Release Notes 
 * Release Date : 30-Dec-2017

This Request is used to Export Users to CSV ##### Usage Notes 1) If ** userIds ** are not given it will get list of all the users in the exported csv file.
2) If ** fields ** are not given it will list all the fields in the exported csv file.
3) If ** userIds ** and ** fields ** are given it will only get those users with the selected field values in the csv file.
4) **'userName'** and **'email'** field will be automatically set if at least one **fields** value is given and those field values are not **'userName'** and **'email'** ##### Field Values Allowed "email", "uid", "userName", "rank", "jobRole", "country", "city", "state", "lastLogin","groups", "pages", "roles", "createdBy", "createdOn" ##### Release Notes * Release Date : 26-January-2020

This API returns the average of metrics
 ##### Usage Description
 Available filters at all Analysis Level : organizationIds, projectIds, collectionIds, developerIds, employerIds.

 collectionIds, projectIds, organizationIds, developerIds, employerIds

This Request is used to generate Collection level click through Charts

* **Calendar Metrics** : bce, avg_bce, pct_ab_ce.
* **Stats Metrics** : ce_hours, ce_units, pct_ab_ce.
* **Raw Metrics** : halstead_flux, comment_flux, filesize_flux, nom_flux, dac_flux, fanout_flux, loc_added, loc_removed, loc_flux, cyclo_flux.
* **Aberrant Metrics** : pct_ab_ce.

##### Metrics Restrictions
* Any **Calendar Metrics** is not supported with any **Stats Metrics**.
* Any **Raw Metrics** is not supported with any **Aberrant Metrics**.

This Request is used to generate File Directory Commits Chart - Collection data

Analysis Levels : employers, developers

* developers : developerIds
* employers : employerIds

Filters sent in request other than the supported ones, **will be ignored.**

* **Calendar Metrics** : bce, avg_bce, ab_bce, ab_avg_bce.
* **Stats Metrics** : ce_hours, ce_units, ab_ce_hours, ab_ce_units.
* **Raw Metrics** : halstead_flux, comment_flux, filesize_flux, nom_flux, dac_flux, fanout_flux, loc_added, loc_removed, loc_flux, cyclo_flux.
* **Aberrant Metrics** : ab_ce_hours, ab_ce_units, ab_bce, ab_avg_bce.

##### Metrics Restrictions
* Any **Calendar Metrics** is not supported with any **Stats Metrics**.
* Any **Calendar Metrics** is not supported with any **Raw Metrics**.
* Any **Raw Metrics** is not supported with any **Aberrant Metrics**.

This Request is used to List of all DataSource ##### Filters **Descriptions** 
{ 
  "instanceUrl": (string URL), #optional 
  "instanceName": (string), #optional, Name of the infra 
  "schedule":{ #optional, if isn't present - all schedules will be chosen by default
                      "interval": { // optional, present if schedule is turned on 
                                        "period":(string "days/weeks/months") 
                                        "value":(integer)
                                  }
             },
  "lastUpdate": (string yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss), #optional, send date from headers in previous request 
  "lastUpdateBy": (string), #optional, Name of the users who made lastupdate on given infra 
  "createdBy": (string), #optional,  Name of the users who created the infra  
  "status": (string, "Not Validated/Validated/Validation Failed/Integrator Offline/Detached"), #optional, if isn't present - all datasource statuses will be chosen by default 
  "errorCode": (string), #optional 
  "organizationIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all organziations will be chosen by default 
  "projectIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all projects for the given organziations will be chosen by default 
  "collectionIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all collections for the given projects will be chosen by default 
  "projectName": (string), #optional 
  "collectionName": (string), #optional 
  "componentName": (string), #optional 
  "integratorIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all integrators will be chosen by default 
  "infraTypeIds": "[(integer),... ]", #optional, Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
}

post.description:
This Request is used to Update DataSource ##### Usage Notes **integratorId** is required
**organizationId** has to be present when **'type'** of **'infraType'** is **taskTracker** (optional for update)
**collectionId** has to be present when **'type'** of **'infraType'** is **versionControl**
In **repositoryUserDetails** if **overrideAtIntegrator** is set to **false** then **pass** value has to be provided

**Allowable Values :**
**period :** days/weeks/months
**acquireData** startDate, endDate : yyyy-MM-dd
**schedule** startDate : yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
**organizationId** cannot be updated. Feature not yet supported
**Infra Type Details**
versionControl
"name" = **Subversion/CollabnetSVN/IntlandSVN/PolarionSVN/uberSVN**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "projectURL": (string URL),
                  "trunkLocation": (string), //optional, present if user choose advanced view, in advanced view this field is required
                  "branchLocation": (string), //optional, present if user choose advanced view, can be present only if "trunkLocation" is present
                  "tagsLocation" : (string) //optional, present if user choose advanced view, can be present only if "trunkLocation" is present
          }


"name" = **GitHub/GitLab/BitBucket/Git/TeamFoundationServer_vc_git**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "cloneURL": (string URL)
          }


"name" = **Perforce**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "serverURL": (string URL),
                  "depotPath": (string)
          }


"name" = **TeamFoundationServer_vc**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "collectionURL": (string URL),
                  "project" : (string)
          }


"name" = **RationalTeamConcert_vc**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "serverURL": (string URL),
                  "component" : (string)
          }


taskTracker
"name" = **Rally**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "serverURL": (string URL),
                  "workspace": (string),
                  "project": (string) //optional, if is not present - default value will be '\*'
          }


"name" = **Jira**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "repositoryURL": (string URL),
                  "versionNumber": (string),

          }

          }


"name" = **RationalTeamConcert_tt**
"id": Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
"details":{
                  "serverURL": (string URL),
                  "project": (string)
          }


##### Schedule Update In Schedule start date time part of the provided date will be used to update the time part of the existing schedule start date so there wont be any change on the date component of the schedule start date. For e.g. if existing schedule start is "2015-10-11 10:15" and you update it with "2017-08-08 11:15" then the date will be updated to "2015-10-11 11:15" ##### Schedule Timezone Default timezone for schedule start date is UTC but custom timezone can also be provided. For e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52" , "2017-01-01 10:53 UTC" and "2017-01-01 10:53 GMT" are supported formats. It also supports timezones provided with respect to GMT for e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52 GMT+5:30" where GMT+5:30 is timezone for India ##### Deprecation Notes * Deprecated since : 16-March-2019 * End of Life : **16-Sep-2019**

**requestsCount :** This gives the total count of each extraction status for a dataSource.
**extractionDate :** This gives the first and last extraction date for a successfully completed extraction for a dataSource. ##### Filters **Descriptions** 
{ 
  "instanceUrl": (string URL), #optional 
  "instanceName": (string), #optional, Name of the infra 
  "schedule":{ #optional, if isn't present - all schedules will be chosen by default
                      "interval": { // optional, present if schedule is turned on 
                                        "period":(string "days/weeks/months") 
                                        "value":(integer)
                                  }
             },
  "lastUpdate": (string yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss), #optional, send date from headers in previous request 
  "lastUpdateBy": (string), #optional, Name of the users who made lastupdate on given infra 
  "createdBy": (string), #optional,  Name of the users who created the infra  
  "status": (string, "Not Validated/Validated/Validation Failed/Integrator Offline/Detached"), #optional, if isn't present - all datasource statuses will be chosen by default 
  "errorCode": (string), #optional 
  "organizationIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all organziations will be chosen by default 
  "projectIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all projects for the given organziations will be chosen by default 
  "collectionIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all collections for the given projects will be chosen by default 
  "projectName": (string), #optional 
  "collectionName": (string), #optional 
  "componentName": (string), #optional 
  "integratorIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all integrators will be chosen by default 
  "infraTypeIds": "[(integer),... ]", #optional, Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
}

post.description:
This Request is used to Update DataSources in Bulk ##### Bulk Datasources Update **datasourceIds:** required, ids of Datasources that need to be updated
**collectionId:** optional, present if collectionId needs to updated in datasources and if type of infraType is versionControl
**repositoryUserDetails:** optional, present if user details need to be updated
**integratorId:** optional,present if integrator needs to be updated in datasources
**acquireData:** optional, present if acquireData needs to be updated in datasources
**schedule:** optional, present if schedule needs to be updated in datasources
if schedule is empty (all properties are absent) - it means that turned off was selected in UI
##### Schedule Update In Schedule start date time part of the provided date will be used to update the time part of the existing schedule start date so there wont be any change on the date component of the schedule start date. For e.g. if existing schedule start is "2015-10-11 10:15" and you update it with "2017-08-08 11:15" then the date will be updated to "2015-10-11 11:15" ##### Schedule Timezone Default timezone for schedule start date is UTC but custom timezone can also be provided. For e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52" , "2017-01-01 10:53 UTC" and "2017-01-01 10:53 GMT" are supported formats. It also supports timezones provided with respect to GMT for e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52 GMT+5:30" where GMT+5:30 is timezone for India ##### Filters **Descriptions** 
{ 
  "instanceUrl": (string URL), #optional 
  "instanceName": (string), #optional, Name of the infra 
  "schedule":{ #optional, if isn't present - all schedules will be chosen by default
                      "interval": { // optional, present if schedule is turned on 
                                        "period":(string "days/weeks/months") 
                                        "value":(integer)
                                  }
             },
  "lastUpdate": (string yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss), #optional, send date from headers in previous request 
  "lastUpdateBy": (string), #optional, Name of the users who made lastupdate on given infra 
  "createdBy": (string), #optional,  Name of the users who created the infra  
  "status": (string, "Not Validated/Validated/Validation Failed/Integrator Offline/Detached"), #optional, if isn't present - all datasource statuses will be chosen by default 
  "errorCode": (string), #optional 
  "organizationIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all organziations will be chosen by default 
  "projectIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all projects for the given organziations will be chosen by default 
  "collectionIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all collections for the given projects will be chosen by default 
  "projectName": (string), #optional 
  "collectionName": (string), #optional 
  "componentName": (string), #optional 
  "integratorIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all integrators will be chosen by default 
  "infraTypeIds": "[(integer),... ]", #optional, Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
}
 ##### Usage Notes 1) **dataSourceIds** and **excludes** both shouldn't be present at once
2) Either **dataSourceIds** or other filters should be provided.
3) Other filters cannot be given when **dataSourceIds** are present
4) **excludes**(This excludes the specific dataSource) can only be used when the filters are present ##### Release Notes * Release Date : 01-May-2016

This Request is used to generate Timeless Charts
 ##### Usage Description
 Available filters at all Analysis Level : organizationIds, projectIds, collectionIds, developerIds, employerIds.
 Only one filter at a time can be sent in request. If more than 1 filter is passed then 1 filter will be accepted by using following Preference order : 
 collectionIds, projectIds, organizationIds, developerIds, employerIds

 ##### List of Supported Metrics
* **Calendar Metrics** : bce, avg_bce, ab_bce, ab_avg_bce.
* **Stats Metrics** : ce_hours, ce_units, ab_ce_hours, ab_ce_units.
* **Raw Metrics** : halstead_flux, comment_flux, filesize_flux, nom_flux, dac_flux, fanout_flux, loc_added, loc_removed, loc_flux, cyclo_flux.
* **Aberrant Metrics** : ab_ce_hours, ab_ce_units, ab_bce, ab_avg_bce.

##### Metrics Restrictions
* Any **Calendar Metrics** is not supported with any **Stats Metrics**.
* Any **Calendar Metrics** is not supported with any **Raw Metrics**.
* Any **Raw Metrics** is not supported with any **Aberrant Metrics**.
 ##### Release Notes 
 * Release Date : 11-Mar-2017

{

}
 ##### Release Notes * Release Date : 16-March-2019

This Request is used to Export DataSources to CSV ##### Usage Notes 1) If ** dataSourceIds ** are not given it will get list of all the dataSources in the exported csv file.
2) If ** fields ** are not given it will list all the fields in the exported csv file.
3) If ** dataSourceIds ** and ** fields ** are given it will only get those dataSources with the selected field values in the csv file.
4) **'instanceName'** and **'instanceUrl'** field will be automatically set if at least one **fields** value is given and those field values are not **'instanceName'** and **'instanceUrl'**
5) **excludes** cannot be given when **dataSourceIds** are present
6) Other filters cannot be given when **dataSourceIds** are present
7) **excludes**(This excludes the specific dataSource while exporting the csv) can only be used when the filters are present ##### Field Values Allowed "organization", "projectName", "collectionName", "infraTypeName", "instanceUrl", "instanceName", "componentName", "integratorName", "scheduleIntervalPeriod", "scheduleStartDate", "createdBy", "createdOn", "lastUpdatedBy", "updatedOn", "status", "errorMessage", "requestsCount", "healthIndicator", "firstExtractionDate", "lastExtractionDate", "lastValidation", "lastValidationStatusCode" ##### Sorting Values Allowed organization/projectName/collectionName/infraTypeName/instanceUrl/instanceName/componentName/integratorName/scheduleIntervalPeriod/scheduleStartDate/createdBy/createdOn /lastUpdateBy/updateOn/status/requestsCount/health/firstExtractionDate/lastExtractionDate/lastValidationDate/errorCode

##### Schedule Update In Schedule start date time part of the provided date will be used to update the time part of the existing schedule start date so there wont be any change on the date component of the schedule start date. For e.g. if existing schedule start is "2015-10-11 10:15" and you update it with "2017-08-08 11:15" then the date will be updated to "2015-10-11 11:15" ##### Schedule Timezone Default timezone for schedule start date is UTC but custom timezone can also be provided. For e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52" , "2017-01-01 10:53 UTC" and "2017-01-01 10:53 GMT" are supported formats. post.description:
This Request is used to Get Status of all DataSources ##### Filters **Descriptions** 
{ 
  "instanceUrl": (string URL), #optional 
  "instanceName": (string), #optional, Name of the infra 
  "schedule":{ #optional, if isn't present - all schedules will be chosen by default
                      "interval": { // optional, present if schedule is turned on 
                                        "period":(string "days/weeks/months") 
                                        "value":(integer)
                                  }
             },
  "lastUpdate": (string yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss), #optional, send date from headers in previous request 
  "lastUpdateBy": (string), #optional, Name of the users who made lastupdate on given infra 
  "createdBy": (string), #optional,  Name of the users who created the infra  
  "status": (string, "Not Validated/Validated/Validation Failed/Integrator Offline/Detached"), #optional, if isn't present - all datasource statuses will be chosen by default 
  "errorCode": (string), #optional 
  "organizationIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all organziations will be chosen by default 
  "projectIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all projects for the given organziations will be chosen by default 
  "collectionIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all collections for the given projects will be chosen by default 
  "projectName": (string), #optional 
  "collectionName": (string), #optional 
  "componentName": (string), #optional 
  "integratorIds": [(integer), ...], #optional, if isn't present - all integrators will be chosen by default 
  "infraTypeIds": "[(integer),... ]", #optional, Id of the infra, v1/dataSources/infraTypes can be used to get 'id' of each infrastructure
}
 ##### Release Notes * Release Date : 01-May-2016

##### Schedule Update In Schedule start date time part of the provided date will be used to update the time part of the existing schedule start date so there wont be any change on the date component of the schedule start date. For e.g. if existing schedule start is "2015-10-11 10:15" and you update it with "2017-08-08 11:15" then the date will be updated to "2015-10-11 11:15" ##### Schedule Timezone Default timezone for schedule start date is UTC but custom timezone can also be provided. For e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52" , "2017-01-01 10:53 UTC" and "2017-01-01 10:53 GMT" are supported formats. It also supports timezones provided with respect to GMT for e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52 GMT+5:30" where GMT+5:30 is timezone for India ##### Response **DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS : ** Another datsource update is running for your enterprise, datasource update will not be allowed until the already running update completes.
**DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.SUCCESS : ** Datatsource update successful.
**DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.FAIL : ** Datatsource update failed.

collectionId
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions": " optional, present if type of infraType = versionControl " 

}
organizationId
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions":  "optional, present if type of infraType = taskTracker" 

 }
acquireData
{ 
  "startDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) present if acquireData is not none, 
  "endDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) present if acquireData is not none, 
  "descriptions":  "if none was selected in UI - acquireData:{} object will be empty" 

 }
schedule
{ 
  "startDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) optional, present if schedule is turned on, 
  "interval":  optional, present if schedule is turned on 
  "descriptions":  "if turned off was selected in UI - schedule:{} object will be empty" 

 }
clonedFrom
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions": " optional, present only if user clones data source from other data source, send dataSourceId of the needed data source " 

}

##### Schedule Start Date Schedule start date needs to be current date only. (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) ##### Schedule Timezone Default timezone for schedule start date is UTC but custom timezone can also be provided. For e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52" , "2017-01-01 10:53 UTC" and "2017-01-01 10:53 GMT" are supported formats. It also supports timezones provided with respect to GMT for e.g. "2017-01-01 10:52 GMT+5:30" where GMT+5:30 is timezone for India ##### Response **DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.ALREADY_IN_PROGRESS : ** Another datsource update is running for your enterprise, datasource update will not be allowed until the already running update completes.
**DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.SUCCESS : ** Datatsource update successful.
**DATA_SOURCE.UPDATE.FAIL : ** Datatsource update failed.

collectionId
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions": " optional, present if type of infraType = versionControl " 

}
organizationId
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions":  "optional, present if type of infraType = taskTracker" 

 }
acquireData
{ 
  "startDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) present if acquireData is not none, 
  "endDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) present if acquireData is not none, 
  "descriptions":  "if none was selected in UI - acquireData:{} object will be empty" 

 }
schedule
{ 
  "startDate": (string yyyy-MM-dd) optional, present if schedule is turned on, 
  "interval":  optional, present if schedule is turned on 
  "descriptions":  "if turned off was selected in UI - schedule:{} object will be empty" 

 }
clonedFrom
{ 
  "type": "integer", 
  "descriptions": " optional, present only if user clones data source from other data source, send dataSourceId of the needed data source " 

}
